The search leads you to Cedar Hills Steel Mill, "where chilling secrets await, revealing a far more sinister truth than anyone could have anticipated". I am anticipating: QTEs during escape sequences, branching choices that get people killed, and General Mature Content appropriate to the coming of Halloween.
 Read more
articles.title: Here's a demo for Dead By Daylight spin-off The Casting Of Frank Stone, from the makers of Until Dawn

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you live in the UK, you may have noticed that this week is shy a working day. Credulous fools attribute this to the existence of a "bank holiday" on Monday 26th, but true initiates like ourselves know the sobering truth: the Maw has eaten one of our weekdays. We have dispatched our finest gastronauts equipped with extremely long pairs of tweezers to retrieve the missing Monday from the Maw's bowels. We can only hope it hasn't been digested yet - imagine living in a world with a four-day working week? The horror. Anyway, here are this week's PC game releases of note.
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Almost a decade after his acrimonious departure from Konami, the shadow of Hideo Kojima still looms over Metal Gear Solid. He's there, barely camouflaged, in the undergrowth of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater - a remake of the fifth Metal Gear game, originally released in 2004, which tells the tale of a lone US special operator hunting superweapons and old mentors in the jungles of the southern Soviet Union. 


I say "remake" but this feels more like a re-release, in spirit. True, it now runs on Unreal Engine, with the option of a manual, third-person perspective and cover-shooter controls in addition to the old top-down viewpoints. Yes, it boasts new flourishes, such as wounds now leaving scars, and clothes picking up stray leaves. Yes, there's a new interface with floating in-world menus, which makes shuffling between the layers a bit less awkward. It's the product of much labour, with development split between Konami and external support partner Virtuos. But where Konami's other big restoration project, Bloober's Silent Hill 2 remake, is a creative dialogue with the original game, Delta seems consumed by faithfulness to Kojima's original design.

 
Read more
articles.title: Does Metal Gear Solid need a new Kojima? Konami have “many people” in mind, but it's "difficult"

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! As is customary, I must jam my new cat into every article. I’ve tried to offer her several books, but she’s failed to turn even a single page so far. What a big dumbo. The best dumbo. The sweetest, smartest dumbo in the world, yes she is. Ahem. This week, it’s Supermassive, Niantic, and Sensible Object narrative designer and Limit Break mentor, Anastasia Dukakis! Cheers Ana! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Supermassive and Niantic narrative designer Anastasia Dukakis

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for more cat. She’s flop and headbutt-level comfortable around me now, but she still seems a bit terrified of my house in general. I’m going to hang out with her a bunch and see if I can instill some sort of object permanence re: my presence in the home. Before that, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Stranger Video is a website that wants access to your webcam. Grant it and it will show you a close-up of your own face, the background around you cropped out. Close your eyes to tell it you're ready, and open them again when you hear a chime. It'll now connect you to a stranger doing the same thing: first person to blink loses.

You can play it here.

 
Read more
articles.title: Let's have a staring contest

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Valve have their own rating system for measuring how games run on Steam Deck, but even following the guidance of whether something is "Playable" or "Verified", I've still run into games that simply do not work on the handheld device.

Enter Steam reviews. Reviews from players who primarily played on Steam Deck will now have a little Deck icon, which when moused over tells you the exact amount of time spent on the Deck.

 
Read more
articles.title: You can now filter Steam reviews to show those who "played mostly on Steam Deck"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Tens of thousands of people have been playing Deadlock, a new multiplayer shooter from Valve, for the past several months, but in that time there's been no official announcement or acknowledgement of the game's existence by its creators. Until now. Valve have posted an extremely barebones Steam store page for Deadlock, describing it as a "multiplayer game in early development."

 
Read more
articles.title: Deadlock, Valve's new multiplayer shooter, now has a barebones Steam page

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Hello hello hello! This is Edwin chatting. I don't usually get to do these weekend features, but Ollie and James are busy working their magic (stripmining Black Myth: Wukong for guides and fleeing Gamescom), while Nic can't type complete words anymore without getting his hands eaten (see latest domestic update, below). I know that Ollie usually does a picture puzzle for you, but I am comparatively innocent in the ways of Photoshop and more importantly, very lazy - so lazy that I can't think of an elegant way to complete this paragraph, and will proceed immediately to stating: here's what we're all playing this weekend.
 
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you like jumping on enveloping pixelly architecture while basking in an atmosphere of pathological sadness, set aside some time on 20th September, because that’s when Rubeki's first-person spelunker Lorn’s Lure launches on Steam. Ah, I've been waiting a while for this one. Catch a new trailer below.
 Read more
articles.title: Amazingly grim retro sci-fi android spelunker Lorn’s Lure finally has a release date

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Everything I know about the French Revolution has hitherto come from two literary works: Hilary Mantel's excellent doorstopper A Place Of Greater Safety, and Kate Beaton's webcomics. Neither Mantel nor Beaton mention mechs, which are a core feature of Studio Imugi's new "ideology driven" turn-based strategy game Bonaparte: A Mechanized Revolution. I, for one, feel like I've been grossly ill-informed. Kate, Hilary - I've been quoting you for years at parties and it seems like all this time, people have been silently judging me for my ignorance of the role giant clockwork soldiers played in the fall of the Bastille.
 Read more
articles.title: Turn-based strategy game Bonaparte wants to redo the French Revolution, but this time with mechs

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
"Age of Empires with dinosaurs" is, the developers of the Dinolords recently told me in a cramped Gamescom booth, a flattering description for their upcoming England vs. Vikingsaurus RTS. It’s also not a terribly accurate one. From what I saw of the game, Dinolords is more about the lords than the dinos, having as much in common with Diablo-style ARPGs as it does with classic strategy. And that’s a distinction which might just elevate it out of novelty status.
Read more
articles.title: T-Rexes aren’t the only twist that Dinolords puts on medieval strategy

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Take the ballroom scene from Disney's Beauty And The Beast, swap the wailing utensils for an army of chibi cats, endow Belle with low-key Doctor Manhattan-grade powers of matter transformation, and you're perhaps beginning to approximate the experience of Infinity Nikki - an open world dress-up adventure from Singapore-based Infold and former Legend of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild developer Kentaro Tominaga.
Trailered this week at Gamescom 2024, it's the fifth installment in the hitherto mobile-focussed Nikki series and it's seemingly going down a storm, with over 12 million pre-registrations so far (albeit, many of them motivated by the prospect of collectively unlocked in-game bonuses). It's also a free-to-play game, and I have the usual unanswered questions about currencies and gacha, but I'm willing to give it the benefit of the doubt for the minute, because I have not spent nearly enough of my life considering the tactical applications of ballgowns. Here's that trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Glamtime never ends in Infinity Nikki, the open world dress-up game from Zelda talent

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
A few months back, I enjoyed lurking a conversation on the RPS Discord about the proliferation of cyberpunk/steampunk/atompunk/what-have-you-punk variants and how most of them in fact lack the rebelliousness and counter-counter elements that punk actually entails. That discussion was back on my mind as I sat down to play Reignbreaker, a new action-roguelike from Studio Fizbin, at Gamescom 2024 – slightly wary of its self-described medievalpunk styling. However! Turns out you’re trying to kill the queen. Yep, that’s, uh, that’s pretty punk.
Read more
articles.title: Reignbreaker is an anti-establishment roguelike that’s clearly pro-Hades

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I can guarantee you that a zombie survival game called God Save Birmingham wasn't on your "2024 Video Game Announcements" bingo card. It takes place in 14th century England, and tasks you with fending off the rampant zombie hordes of a populace who've succumbed to a mysterious case of reanimation. Perhaps the cause is that there's no Maccies or TK Maxx at the local Bull Ring yet.
Read more
articles.title: Here's an open world zombie survival game set in medieval.... Birmingham?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’m still a little giddy over how much I enjoyed lucarne-lobbing puzzler Tactical Breach Wizards. So much so that I mentioned in my review how I’m well up for another run of its fifteen hour campaign. I’d already got a few missions into hard mode. There's no more starting mana points! It’s a real...pane.
Now, I might have to start again, even if going out of my way to grab the tapes added in its developer's commentary mode is going to be extra tricky. Ah, but will being able to chuck the recorders at my enemies for a point of knockback afterwards make up for it?
 
Read more
articles.title: Even Tactical Breach Wizards' developer commentary can be used to knock people out of windows

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Earlier this year, Bungie's 1990s sci-fi shooter, Marathon, came to Steam for free. And Marathon 2 followed in July. But this series is a trilogy. Where's the third one? I want the thir-- oh, it's here now. Yesterday, the final game, Marathon Infinity trickled onto the storefront, offering a neat little bundle for fans of retro shooters. But it's also a reminder that we've yet to see more of Bungie's upcoming reboot.
Read more
articles.title: The full original Marathon trilogy is now free on Steam, but Bungie are still quiet on the reboot

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
One of my formative video game moments is the final mission of Psygnosis cyberpunk flight sim G-Police. (It came out in 1997, and as such, I think the statute of limitations on spoilers has passed, but if you still intend to play, stop reading now.) The mission completes the long arc of foreshadowing begun by the intro's mention that capital-class spacecraft have been outlawed, following a ruinous war. It turns out that one particular evil corpo has been sneakily building one of these megaships - not only that, but you get to fly inside it, cannons ablazing. It was while doing so that teenage me realised the true exceptionality of the Video Game Artform. You can't fly inside capital ships in, like, symbolist poems or baroque symphonies, can you? You can't fly in poems or symphonies at all, unless you do so metaphorically - "metaphor" being a kind of poor man's graphics card.
The technology of flight simming has advanced mightily since G-Police's day. For instance: in Everspace 2's just-announced Titans DLC, you get to fly inside not just regular old spaceships, but massive space kaiju with procedurally generated digestive systems. Here's the trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Everspace 2 turns Monster Hunter with secret nebula-dwelling kaiju that are essentially living procgen dungeons

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Assassin's Creed: Valhalla, Odyssey, and Origins all have one thing in common: they've got a Discovery mode, which replaces murdering with learning. You can, quite literally, go on tours curated by historians around each of the game's respective maps. Instead of diving off a Sphinx and plunging your hidden blade into someone's spinal column, you can look up at the Sphinx and read a paragraph on its significance. Maybe view an actual, real life bit of ancient Egypt from an actual real life museum collection in-game. Perhaps embody an Anglo-Saxon lad in Valhalla, instead, and like, cook up some nettle soup having just got a fresh "Friar Tuck" at the local hair choppers (no guarantees on this last bit).
This is all to say that Black Myth: Wukong deserves such a mode, too. There were so many times throughout my review time where I stopped and stared and wondered as to something's meaning. Not only in the architecture, but in the characters, too. So here I am with a proposition: how about instead of thwacking things with my staff, I can use it as a walking stick and point it at things I want to learn about.
Read more
articles.title: Black Myth: Wukong needs an Assassin's Creed-style discovery mode

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We haven't written about Diplomacy Is Not An Option since it launched in Early Access in 2022, when it was a light and frothy strategy game about smashing thousands of peasants to bits with physics magic. It's still that, but now it's getting a 1.0 release on October 4th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Diplomacy Is Not An Option's castle-building spectacle-strategy gets a 1.0 release October 4th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We've been distracted by Gamescom, several game releases, the rapid dwindling of the British summer. Or I assume we have, for why else would we not have yet posted about the Steam Rhythm Fest, which began on Monday and runs until August 26th at 10am PT/6pm BRDST*.

 
Read more
articles.title: Steam Rhythm Fest is underway with discounts and demos for games with a good beat

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I recently wrote about a game that aimed to recreate the old magic of Tokyo Xtreme Racer, a series of late-night, urban racing games that hadn't had a new (non-mobile) entry in 18 years. Oh, what a neglected niche those indie developers were filling!

Yeah, a new Tokyo Xtreme Racer was just announced from original developers Genki, and it's targeting a Steam release next year.

 
Read more
articles.title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer is returning after 18 years, with a new game coming to Steam next year

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Ubisoft have announced Heroes of Might & Magic: Olden Era, a fresh instalment in the exceedingly olden turn-based strategy RPG series, which began life under New World Computing in 1995. The new game will “return to the world of Enroth and the origins of the legendary saga”, inviting “both veterans and new players” to go on a quest to Jadame, “a mysterious continent in turmoil”. Expect new factions, biomes and creatures, together with such M&M standbys as castle management, army clashes, hex-based maps, and, who knows, maybe some heroes.
 Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft announce new back-to-roots Heroes of Might & Magic game with the Iratus devs in charge

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you've been necromantically dreaming of a Callisto Protocol sequel, I'm afraid the monkey paw finger hasn't just curled - it's jammed itself right up your nose and scratched an FU on your hypothalamus. Developers Striking Distance and publishers Krafton have revealed [REDACTED], a scifi roguelike dungeon crawler set in the same universe.
The square brackets are part of the title, yes, and they're also calling it "punk rock" - a combination of factors that fills me with a rage so obliterating, I can barely perceive the announcement trailer, below. It's a machinegun montage of comicbook panels and sizzling melee arcs and quips like "there's a lot of wankers between you and the sweet taste of freedom". I didn't even like The Callisto Protocol that much but still, what have they done to you, boy? Where did all the horror game go?
 Read more
articles.title: The Callisto Protocol series returns as... top-down roguelike geezer shooter [REDACTED]

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Hledáte vhodný termín pro společnou událost? Nejen v tomto případě by vám mohl přijít vhod článek, který popisuje zkušenost s preferenčním hlasováním účastníků ve sdílené tabulce dokumentu Google Sheets s využitím Schulzeho metody.
articles.title: Preferenční hlasování ve sdílené tabulce Schulzeho metodou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Tato taškařice, vhodná na Apríla, je původně starý text z roku 2001 ze sekce „Zasmáli jsme se“ Linuxových novin, jsem autorem, takže jej ještě copypastuju na blog, abych na něj ex post upozornil.
articles.title: Šokující tajemství unixových systémů: hyperuživatel odhalen

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: Podíváme se na nový útok umožňující klonovat tokeny YubiKey, nové trendy v sextortion útocích, nebo zprávu o útocích ruské APT skupiny, na jejíž přípravě participovali i české zpravodajské služby.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: klonování hardwarových tokenů YubiKey

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt FreeBSD bude brzy dostane investici od německého fondu Sovereign Tech Fund (STF) ve výši 686 400 eur. Vývojáři KDE vtěsnali několik dalších funkcí do chystaného prostředí Plasma 6.2.
articles.title: FreeBSD dostane peníze od německého STF, nové funkce pro Plasma 6.2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Knihovna Cairo má po roce novou stabilní verzi, Intel Arc konečně s měřením otáček ventilátorů na Linuxu 6.12, Mesa 24.2.2 s podporou Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage / Xe2, vývojová verze Wine 9.17.
articles.title: Dopad záplat na Zen5 se limitně blíží nule, Wine opravuje podporu čtvrt století starého QuickTime

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Tímto příspěvkem bych chtěl volně navázat na předchozí články zabývající se klasifikací obrázků do několika tříd. V těch dřívějších článcích se jednalo o rozpoznání zápalu plic na základě RTG snímků.
articles.title: Lokalizace infekce malárie: klasifikační model a heatmap

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dnes vynecháme menší dílčí novinky v budoucím vydání jádra Linux 6.12, naopak se podíváme primárně na poslední práce, které na tomto poli odvádí Intel pro své nejnovější grafické jádro generace Xe2.
articles.title: Novinky pro Linux 6.12 s důrazem na Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: K zobrazení textové informace je potřeba písmo. Jeho volba významně ovlivňuje čitelnost textu a má velký dopad na uživatelský zážitek. Pojďme se podívat, jaké máme v písmech možnosti, jak je využívat, co dělat a čemu se naopak vyhnout.
articles.title: Písma a jejich použití: od beden s odlitky ke stažení souborů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ještě jednou se vrátíme k modelu pro lineární regresi. S ním jsme se již setkali, ovšem ve skutečnosti je i zdánlivě jednoduchý koncept lineární regrese realizován tak, že ho lze využít mnoha dalšími způsoby.
articles.title: Scikit-learn: jednoduchý a současně i univerzální model lineární regrese

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Ondřej Surý)
articles.description: Nová verze DNS serveru BIND 9.20.0 přináší významná vylepšení po dvou letech vývoje. Klíčové novinky zahrnují nové aplikační a databázové jádro, optimalizovanou podporu DNSSEC a vylepšenou kompresi DNS jmen.
articles.title: BIND 9.20: vylepšený výkon resolveru a nové databázové a aplikační jádro

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Vývojář KDE  Nate Graham na svém blogu před dvěma týdny napsal, že KDE bude jednou za rok zobrazovat žádost o finanční příspěvek. Bude to v prosinci a je jedno, jak tuto žádost uživatel zavře. Objeví se zase až za rok.
articles.title: KDE/Plasma bude jednou za rok zobrazovat žádost o finanční příspěvek

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Notebook Slimbook Plasma VI byl představen na konferenci KDE Akademy a už je podrobně popsán na webu kde.slimbook.es. Je vybaven procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS s integrovanou grafikou Radeon 780M, displejem s rozlišením 2560×1600, hliníkovým šasi a sloty na DDR5–5600 s podporou až 96 GB RAM.
articles.title: KDE Slimbook VI je poháněn procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Alejandro Colomar, který poslední čtyři roky spravoval linuxové manuálové stránky, oznámil, že bude muset tuto práci ukončit. Tuto užitečnou činnost totiž dělal ve svém volném čase a žádná firma jeho práci nesponzorovala. V současné době již nemohu tuto práci ekonomicky udržet. Dočasně a na dobu neurčitou tedy přestanu na tomto projektu pracovat, vysvětluje ve svém mailu.
articles.title: Údržba linuxových manuálových stránek byla pozastavena

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tým vývojářů okolo webového serveru Nginx oznámil, že oficiální vývoj otevřeného kódu projektu Nginx se přesunul z Mercurialu na GitHub. Projekt tedy bude nyní přijímat příspěvky ve formě pull requestů.
articles.title: Nginx přesunul svůj vývoj na GitHub

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Minulý týden jsme tu měli projekt internetového rádia Yoradio s ESP32. Poté jsem byl upozorněn na projekt AM/FM rádia, také založeném na ESP32 a čipu TEF6686/TEF6687. Projekt založila skupina kolem FMDX.org. Dokáže přijímat FM OIRT a CCIR 65–108 MHz a také AM dlouhé, střední a krátké vlny 144 kHz – 27 MHz.
articles.title: Open source AM/FM rádio s ESP32

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description:
Server Phoronix testoval server s procesorem AmpereOne A192–32X 
(192 Arm64 jader na 3,2 GHz) na jádře 6.11 s výchozí stránkou 4 kB a 64 kB. Jako téměř všechny Arm64 procesory je výchozí stránka konfigurovatelná a může být 4, 16, nebo 64 kB. Přitom x86 má pouze 4 kB. Větší stránka znamená větší výkon, ale také o trochu větší spotřebu paměti. Google u Androidu chystá přechod z 4 kB na 16 kB a slibuje průměrně o 5–10 % lepší výkon a asi o 9 % větší spotřebu paměti.
articles.title: Test výkonu AmpereOne se stránkou 64 kB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Výzkumníci z Virtuals Protocol vytvořili AI MarioVGG (Virtual Game Generation), která dokáže vytvořit video hru jen podle videa, v tomto případě Super Mario Bros.  Dataset s obrázky ze hry je dostupný na GitHubu. Obsahuje přes 700 tisíc obrázků z 280 úrovní hry. Přitom se rozlišují pouze příkazy „běž doprava“ a „běž doprava a skoč“.
articles.title: AI vytvořilo hru Super Mario jen podle videa

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O podpoře GPU Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage Xe2 v linuxovém jádře jsme tu dnes psali. Dostane se do jádra 6.12.
articles.title: Mesa 24.2.2 podporuje Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage Xe2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: HTTPS se stává běžným, většina webů už ho nasadila. Jak to ale udělat správně, opravdu bezpečně a hlavně bezbolestně? Na školení HTTPS pro správce serverů si ukážeme si nejnovější trendy, prakticky si vyzkoušíme vygenerování certifikátu a nasazení na web server.
articles.title: HTTPS pro správce serverů (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jason Donenfeld, vývojář WireGuardu, již dva roky pracuje na getrandom() ve vDSO, aby bylo možné náhodná čísla v user-space generovat rychleji přímo v jádře. Pro architekturu x86_64 bylo getrandom() ve vDSO začleněno do jádro 6.11.
articles.title: Jádro 6.12 bude mít getrandom() ve vDSO pro Arm64 a LoongArch

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Intel se podělil o několik důležitých novinek týkajících se vyšetřování problému s nestabilitou Vmin Shift u desktopových procesorů Intel Core 13. a 14. generace, o které jsme psali už v srpnu. Výrobce potvrdil, že nová generace procesorů s kódovým označením Arrow Lake a Lunar Lake problémem netrpí.
articles.title: Intel vydal nový seznam procesorů, které nejsou ovlivněny nestabilitou „Vmin Shift“

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojářům operačního systému Redox OS napsaném v jazyce Rust se podařilo vyřešit výkonnostní úzké hrdlo, takže je systém mnohem výkonnější, když běží jako virtuální stroj. V některých syntetických benchmarcích dokonce dokáže běžet „o něco rychleji“ než Linux. Žádná konkrétní čísla ale zveřejněna nebyla.
articles.title: Redox zlepšil výkon ve virtuálním prostředí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili novou verzi virtualizačního nástroje QEMU označenou jako 9.1. Přináší řadu změn v mnoha oblastech, nejdůležitější je ale podpora nových procesorů Intel Icelake-Server-v7, SapphireRapids-v3 a SierraForest a podporu AMD SEV-SNP použitelnou s novými jádry s podporou pro AMD EPYC.
articles.title: Vyšlo QEMU 9.1 s podporou AMD SEV-SNP a akcelerací Intel IAA při migraci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mozilla má zájem o dekodér obrázků JPEG XL napsaný v jazyce Rust kvůli jeho paměťové bezpečnosti. Bobby Holley, technický šéf Firefoxu, vyjádřil svůj postoj k podpoře dekodéru obrázků JPEG XL pro Firefox napsaného v Rustu. Říká v něm, že vývojáři zvažují zařazení nového dekodéru napsaného v Rustu.
articles.title: Mozilla by chtěla dekodér pro JPEG XL napsaný v Rustu, vyvine jej zřejmě Google

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V repozitářích pro aktuální Debian je sice k dispozici více než 74 tisíc balíčků pro architekturu x86_64, ale ne všechny balíčky jsou dobře udržované a část z nich již dlouho nebyla udržována či aktualizována. Vývojáři Debianu nedávno začali diskutovat o tom, jak začít z archivu odstraňovat další z těchto dlouho neudržovaných balíčků.
articles.title: Vývojáři Debianu diskutují o odstranění neudržovaných balíčků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google oznámil, že zdrojový kód systému Android 15 byl uvolněn do projektu Android Open-Source Project (AOSP). Pro telefony Pixel by přitom systém byl měl být vydán během několika následujících týdnů. Ostatní výrobci na svá zařízení dostanou Android 15 v řádu měsíců. Nyní mohou na portaci začít také tvůrci alternativních ROM.
articles.title: Android 15 uvolněn do projektu Android Open-Source

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Pytelka)
articles.description: Tým věnující se projektu Bugzilla připravil po pěti letech novou stabilní verzi 5.2. Současně pokračuje vývoj budoucí verze 6 (projekt Harmony), společně byla vydána verze 5.9.1 - Developer Preview Release.
articles.title: Vyšla Bugzilla 5.2 a 5.91

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Otevřený firmware Coreboot v nové verzi 24.08 podporuje tři desítky dalších desek, kde mezi těmi uživatelsky běžně kupovanými najdeme ASRock Fatal1ty Z87 Professional, Z87E-ITX, Z87M OC Formula, Z97E-ITX/ac či Gigabyte GA-H61M-S2P-R3 a notebook HP EliteBook 8560w. Celkově více než 900 patchů od více než 130 vývojářů stojí i za opravou řady chyb.
articles.title: Coreboot 24.08 přidává 31 základních desek a počáteční podporu Intel Panther Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Příslušný Wayland protokol xx-color-management-v4 pro správu barev (color management) je již součástí kandidáta na vydání ostré verze kompozitoru GNOME Mutter 47. Shrnuje řadu pull requestů implementujích podporu pro barevné prostory sRGB a PQ+Bt.2020 (Perceptual Quantize).
articles.title: GNOME Mutter 47 přinese správu barev na Waylandu a opravu EGLDevice pro starší GeForce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Zatímco s JPEG XL se Google moc nezabývá, AVIF má u něj stále lépe a lépe ustláno. Po jinak běžně Googlem podporovaném formátu WebP, odvozeném od videa WebM, tedy komprese VP8/VP9, nyní do vyhledávání Googlu nyní přibývá podpora obrázků ve formátu AVIF.
articles.title: Google přidává podporu AVIF do vyhledávání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byla objevena zranitelnost v kryptografické knihovně společnosti Infineon, která se používá v zařízeních YubiKey řady 5 a Security Key Series s firmwarem před verzí 5.7.0 a YubiHSM 2 s firmwarem před verzí 2.4.0. Společnost Yubico potvrdila dopad na její bezpečnostní tokeny, závažnost ohodnotila stupněm střední.
articles.title: Chyba v knihovně Infineon ohrožuje soukromé klíče z tokenů YubiKey a dalších zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: VPN umožňuje bezpečně propojit různá zařízení pomocí šifrovaných tunelů. Umožňuje také zapojit uživatele do vnitřní sítě přes zabezpečený přístupový bod. Na školení si prakticky ukážeme, jak to celé nastavit a zprovoznit pomocí nejnovějšího protokolu WireGuard.
articles.title: WireGuard: nasazujeme VPN rychle a jednoduše (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Ač to podle počasí nevypadá, prázdniny skončily. Nesmutněte však, neboť již tento čtvrtek bude Virtuální Bastlírna - setkání elektroniků, bastlířů, ajťáků a všech milovníků techniky! Jaké novinky a témata tam čekají?
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 42: nový mikrokontrolér od Raspberry Pi Foundation

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři Intelu svižně dokončují podporu druhé velké generace svých GPU. Pod názvem Battlemage se snad skutečně objeví plnohodnotné grafické karty, ne jen integrovaná jádra (ač o tom stále kromě neoficiálních zvěstí nemáme informace), nicméně dále vyvíjená podpora v Linuxu a projektech souvisejících naznačuje, že tento projekt Intel k ledu nedal.
articles.title: Podpora pro Intel Battlemage v Linuxu 6.12 a Mesa 24.3 finišuje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Mnoho novinek ve Firefoxu 130 věru co do počtu není, ale dvě z nich potěší našince z Česka i Slovenska. Firefox 130 přináší podporu překladů dílčích částí webových stránek, které již samy jako celek byly přeloženy. V překladech ve Firefoxu pak mezi novými 11 jazyky nalezneme i češtinu a slovenštinu. Mozilla zde nijak, na rozdíl od jiných, nesleduje, co si uživatel nechává přeložit.
articles.title: Firefox 130 vylepšuje překlady stránek, nově umí i češtinu a slovenštinu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Patří datová centra do vesmíru? Acer představuje nové notebooky Swift Copilot+ s procesory Intel Core Ultra (Series 2). Kam míří automatizace sítí. Školy a univerzity stále více doplácejí na zanedbávání zranitelností. Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 36/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Odchylky v interakcích částic mají ukazovat na existenci nových bosonů. Předpovídají nový detekovatelný zdroj gravitačních vln z kolabujících hvězd.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Informatici z Matfyzu získali US patent na vícezdrojový překlad

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ness Czech spouští nový inovační datový hub pro střední a východní Evropu. Fortinet rozšiřuje bezpečnostní platformu pro ochranu kyberneticko-fyzikálních systémů. Umělá inteligence předvídá zločin a odhalí i ukrytou zbraň. Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat. Red Hat na podporu svých implementačních partnerů rozšířil partnerský program.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový objev ve světě polovodičů: Vědci potvrdili existenci další modifikace uhlíku. Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Vodu v hlubinách Marsu nepřeceňovat.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Technosignatury se možná dají snadno přehlédnout

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Slevy v akci Back to School pokračují. Jedna ze stránek, která poskytuje nejlepší nabídku a je také spolehlivá, je Goodoffer24.com. Zde jsou ceny které se vymykají, zvláště pro operační systém Microsoft, a to jak pro současnou verzi, tak předchozí, a také jak pro verze Pro či Home. A dále také, s exkluzivním kódem, můžete získat další 30% slevu, abyste se mohli těšit z doživotních licencí. Nebo jinak, platíte jen jednou a můžete zapomenout na problémy.
articles.title: Slevy na Goodoffer24 Back to School až 91 %: Windows 11 jen za €20, Office za €24!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 35/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acronis představuje novou verzi Acronis True Image na českém trhu. Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %. Vědci vyvinuli metodu detekce jednoatomových defektů v polovodičích. Každá pátá firma zasažena útoky na dodavatelský řetězec hardwaru. České firmy platí po útoků ransomwarem výkupné i 6 milionů Kč.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Navrhují hledat temnou hmotu v neutronových hvězdách. Nová analýza dat z Webbova dalekohledu ukazuje, že s Hubbleovou konstantou nemusí být problém.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Nitridy uhlíku mohou konkurovat diamantu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 34/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V letních měsících byly vydány aktualizace openSUSE Leap a SUSE, FreeBSD, Debianu, na testování zabezpečení zaměřených distribucí Kali a Parrot, dále např. IPFire, EasyOS, Tails či EndeavourOS.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 23-26/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vývojáři KDE ve spolupráci se společností Slimbook oznámili 16palcový notebook KDE Slimbook VI s předinstalovaným KDE Neon s Plasmou 6. Uvnitř se nachází procesor AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS s integrovanou grafickou kartou Radeon 780M.
articles.title: KDE Slimbook VI

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara

articles.description: České bezpečnostní instituce, jmenovitě Vojenské zpravodajství (VZ) a Bezpečnostní informační služba (BIS), ve spolupráci s americkou Agenturou pro kybernetickou a infrastrukturní bezpečnost (CISA), Federálním úřadem pro vyšetřování (FBI), Národní bezpečností agenturou (NSA) a dalšími mezinárodními partnery ze Spojeného království, Austrálie, Kanady, Německa, Nizozemska, Estonska, Ukrajiny a Lotyšska vydaly upozornění (en, pdf), jež se týká kybernetických operací aktéra spojeného s ruskou Hlavní správou rozvědky (GRU), konkrétně 161. Specializovaného školicího střediska (Jednotka 29155). Jednotka 29155 je přinejmenším od roku 2020 zodpovědná za operace v počítačových sítích proti globálním cílům za účelem špionáže, sabotáže a poškození reputace.

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following recent international travels, Linus Torvalds is back to his usual late Sunday Linux kernel release regiment. Linux 6.11-rc7 was released a few minutes ago as Linux 6.11 approaches the finish line...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Windows gamers seem mixed over the AMD Ryzen 9000 series processors, for creator, scientific / HPC, code development, and many other technical computing areas I remain very impressed by the Ryzen 9000 (Zen 5) series desktop processors more than one month into constant testing with these Granite Ridge chips. One of the areas I hadn't explored until now but made me curious given the mixed messaging around gaming was how well workstation graphics workloads were performing with the new processors. For this brief weekend article is a look at the workstation graphics performance between the Ryzen 9 9950X and former Ryzen 9 7950X/7950X3D processors.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 9 9950X vs. Ryzen 9 7950X/7950X3D For Workstation Graphics

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The work written about earlier this year on New Intel Linux Patches Continue Working To Improve Hybrid CPU Task Placement looks like it will be merged for the upcoming Linux 6.12 cycle as the patches have now been queued into the power management subsystem's "-next" branch. This latest Intel Core hybrid handling work is particularly focused on hybrid P/E-core processors without SMT / Hyper Threading, such as found with the upcoming Core Ultra 200V "Lunar Lake" processors...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 To Enhance The Hybrid P/E Core Experience On Intel Lunar Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: OpenBMC as the Linux Foundation project backed by vendors like Intel / Microsoft / Google / Meta for an open-source BMC firmware stack continues to be a growing success. This alternative to long-used proprietary BMC software stacks continues to grow in popularity with AMD now using it on their reference motherboards and Supermicro being another notable user with some of their server platforms. Not entirely new but been meaning to write about it and NVIDIA talked more openly about it this week: NVIDIA is also a big supporter and user of OpenBMC for their high-end AI/HPC servers and BlueField DPU hardware...
articles.title: Even NVIDIA Has Jumped Big On The Open-Source OpenBMC Train

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While RISC-V processors don't need to worry about Meltdown and Spectre or have any other severe CPU vulnerabilities at the moment, with the upcoming Linux 6.12 kernel the RISC-V code is set to enable the generic CPU vulnerabilities support...
articles.title: RISC-V Enabling Generic CPU Vulnerabilities Reporting

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Merged three years ago in Linux 5.12 was IDMAPPED mounts for new use-cases from containers to systemd-homed. IDMAPPED mounts allow for different mounts to expose the same file or directory with different ownership such as for sharing files between multiple users or multiple systems. With time all of the major Linux file-systems have seen support added for IDMAPPED mounts while for Linux 6.12 support is on the way for FUSE file-systems...
articles.title: FUSE Adding IDMAPPED Mounts Support In Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While KDE developers this weekend are busy attending Akademy 2024 as their annual developer conference taking place in Würzburg, Germany, prior to that there were a few last minute features merged for the upcoming Plasma 6.2 desktop...

articles.description: Building off yesterday's release of Wine 9.17 with its latest improvements for enjoying Windows games/apps on Linux, Hangover 9.17 is now out. Hangover as a reminder is the Wine-based effort for running Windows x86 applications under ARM64 Linux by leveraging Wine with emulators like QEMU, FEX, and Box64 for the cross CPU architecture handling...
articles.title: Hangover 9.17 Ships With Wine Wayland Support, Ubuntu 24.10 Packages

This new Slimbook laptop features an AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS SoC and of course uses the KDE Plasma 6 desktop environment out-of-the-box...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: We are just a week or two out from the start of the Linux 6.12 merge window and AMD has submitted a final round of feature updates to DRM-Next of kernel graphics driver changes they want to round out AMDGPU/AMDKFD for this next cycle...
articles.title: AMD Enables Per-Queue Resets For Newer GPUs & Other Linux 6.12 AMDGPU Changes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Cairo 1.18.2 released this week nearly one year after Cairo 1.18's debut for this cross-platform 2D vector graphics library -- in turn that was the project's first stable release in five years. Cairo is important for the GTK toolkit, Mozilla's Gecko engine, and dozens of other software projects. With Cairo 1.18.2 there are many fixes that have accumulated over the past year for bettering this graphics library...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Wine 9.17 is out today as quite an exciting update for this open-source software that allows Windows games and applications to run on Linux systems and other platforms...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel has submitted more kernel graphics driver changes for the upcoming Linux 6.12 cycle. Following the pull requests to DRM-Next last week to enable Lunar Lake Xe2 graphics and Battlemage by default, some more lingering feature patches were merged today. Most exciting with this last round of patches before Linux 6.12? Intel graphics card fan speed reporting is finally wired up for their Linux driver...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the security changes with AMD Zen 5 processors that I haven't seen AMD publicly mention at least not prominently is that the new cores are not vulnerable to Speculative Return Stack Overflow (SRSO). Unlike Zen 4 and prior, under Linux I noticed that Zen 5 is no longer affected by the SRSO "INCEPTION" vulnerability. But of course there does remain other CPU security mitigations in place carried over from Zen 4. For those wondering about the mitigation costs or if it's worthwhile running Zen 5 with the "mitigations=off" insane mode, here are some benchmarks.
articles.title: AMD Zen 5 Not Affected By Inception/SRSO, mitigations=off Yields No Benefit On Ryzen 9000 Series

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in 2022 were a set of patches that allowed compiling the ARM64 Linux kernel from Apple macOS hosts. The intent was for developers just wanting to do some build/smoke testing from under an Apple Silicon device running macOS to see at least any kernel changes are successfully compiling on macOS with its LLVM/Clang-based toolchain. An updated form of those patches were posted today for review...

articles.description: With this week's announcement of the Intel Core Ultra 200V Series "Lunar Lake" processors, I've been very eager to try out the Meteor Lake successor for Linux testing. As sadly is usually the case, for delivering Linux support details and performance benchmarks around launch-time I'm typically left buying a laptop retail for Linux testing. In this case after seeing the Lunar Lake laptops announced this week and their availability, I ended up settling on the ASUS Zenbook S 14 (UX5406SA-S14.U71TB) for the initial Core Ultra 200V series Linux review...
articles.title: Pre-Ordered The ASUS Zenbook S 14 For Intel Core Ultra "Lunar Lake" Linux Testing

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Sent out today were the DRM fixes for 6.11-rc7 ahead of the Linux 6.11-rc7 kernel being released on Sunday. As usual most of the changes revolve around the AMDGPU and Intel i915/Xe drivers plus random fixes to the smaller drivers. There is one change though with the AMD Radeon graphics driver side worth highlighting to address a performance regression affecting recent kernels...

articles.description: Back in 2018 Oracle introduced Libresource as a standardized API for accessing system resource information around memory / network / device statistics and other metrics. Libresource v2 was announced this week as largely a rewrite of the project...

This week an exciting new update on AMD OpenSIL was shared and that they are still on-track for having it production-ready next year...

articles.author: Michael Larabel

For anyone by chance still running an Accelerated Graphics Port (AGP) graphics card in production, FreeBSD is looking at deprecating its generic AGP driver and then potentially removing it in FreeBSD 15.0...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The first alpha release of OpenSSL 3.4 is now available for testing as the next feature update to this widely-used SSL library / cryptography toolkit...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Linux 6.12 the Lunar Lake and Battlemage graphics are being enabled by default for out-of-the-box support with Intel's next-gen Xe2 graphics. Over in user-space the Intel OpenGL and Vulkan driver code has also begun enabling Xe2 graphics by default for use when running on Linux 6.12+. In Mesa besides no longer being hidden by the force probe option, a warning is now removed so users aren't told about unsupported Vulkan support when using Xe2 hardware...

That work was initially focused on x86_64 but beginning with Linux 6.12 and following on this getrandom() vDSO implementation will see expanded CPU architecture support...

The creators behind the Flesh & Blood TCG, Legend Story Studios, has revealed what it's doing to celebrate the game's 5th anniversary. In addition to an event taking place in stores worldwide, there will also be a tournament and a rare hero card to grab to celebrate the game's birthday.


The best part of Flesh & Blood's 5th anniversary for all players is that Crimson Haze, known to many fans as a vengeful ninja who helped get them into the game, is returning as the Ira, Scarlet Revenger. This is a new version of Ira, a hero card that anyone can get by heading down to their local game store and participating in a 5th anniversary celebration event. The card will be tournament legal, so it's worth picking up even if you don't know where it's going to fit in your decks because you don't need …
articles.title: Flesh & Blood 5th anniversary hero card and celebration revealed

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Daily Spin has once again made its return to NBA 2K25's MyCareer mode, and it could be the source of some amazing freebies to aid you on your journey.


One of the foremost vital resources to grind in MyCareer is VCs, which is the premium currency of the game. Of course, you can buy them with the help of microtransactions, but not everyone likes to spend money after paying a premium for the game itself. The daily spin might not always drop bountiful rewards, but you get something on a daily basis. The gifts can range from VCs to essential items like skill boosts, but they all count.


NBA 2K25 Daily Spin location guide


You can try out the Daily Spin right after creating your MyPlayer.



Go through the first phase of playing in the Finals.


Once done, talk with your friend for the introductory dialog.


When you're ready, step out of MyCourt.


If you go right from MyCourt, you'll come across the Arena.


If you go left, you'll come across the "Crocs" store and find the two affiliations - Elite and Rise.


The Daily Spins are located right in front of affiliation entrances.


Step in front of one, and press the X/A button.


Wait for a bit for the rewards to show up. If you're unlucky like me, there won't be any VC. But many have found VC from their spins, and some have received large amounts as well.



Image via Destructoid


Most importantly, the spin is free to draw; you just need to travel to the location and spin the draw. This is the easiest way to earn valuable resources to add to your inventory. While VCs help you grow your MyPlayer attributes, other items can help improve the finer aspects of your build.


If you're not happy with the amounts of freebies, there are microtransactions. The Season 1 pass also rewards you with lot of items that benefit your MyPlayer build. 

The post NBA 2K25 Daily Spin location: How to get free VC in MyCareer? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: NBA 2K25 Daily Spin location: How to get free VC in MyCareer?

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Swen Vincke, CEO of Larian Studios, has revealed that Baldur's Gate 3 players download over 1 million mods in 24 hours. This follows the game's most recent update, which added modding support and a full mod manager. 


Players have been modding Baldur's Gate 3 ever since it was initially released for PC. However, as of the launch of Baldur's Gate 3 Patch 7, fans have a dedicated native mod manager and toolkit built into the game. This makes the game easier to mod than ever before, and that's almost certainly why so many players downloaded so many mods as soon as this update became available and was installed on their PCs. 


Ready, set, mod


Image via Larian Studios


It's hard to quantify just how many Baldur's Gate 3 players must have downloaded mods as soon as Patch 7 was settled. The …
articles.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 players downloaded more than 1 million mods in 24 hours

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 is a game consisting of three main parts. You have the campaign and then PvE and PvP multiplayer modes that will keep you engrossed for dozens of hours. But it's definitely worth knowing how long the campaign will take you. 


I believe that the campaign is the best place to start with Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2. It'll teach you the basic mechanics while also giving you an epic story to experience that blew me away and continues to do so every time I replay a mission. However, it's a time commitment, and you're going to need to make sure you've got enough to get through it before you can even contemplate exploring the wider multiplayer offerings. 


How long is the Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 campaign?


Screenshot by Destructoid


The campaign in Warhamm…
articles.title: How long is the Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 campaign?

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
Once you’ve unlocked the Raccoons in their Cindersap Forest home in Stardew Valley, you’ll have requests to complete in order to unlock further family members. The first of these, Mrs. Raccoon, comes with her own shop, and you don’t need Gold to purchase her wares.


Unlike other vendors in Stardew Valley, Mrs. Raccoon has no use for Gold and instead chooses to use a barter system. In exchange for junk and other items, you can get some rare items and seeds. 


Everything sold at Mrs. Raccoon’s Shop in Stardew Valley


Screenshot by Destructoid


After completing the first request for Mr. Raccoon, his wife will show up the following day, and you’ll have access to her shop. The stock of her shop expands after completing each request for Mr. Raccoon, although she starts out with a selection of seeds that are usually obtained from Seed Spots.


In some cases, it’s possible to start with one item and barter up to much more useful items, such as the following:



Cave Carrot > Mixed Seeds > Raccoon Hat


Mystery Box > Golden Mystery Box > Magic Rock Candy



Here’s everything that she eventually sells, along with which request you’ll need to complete in order to unlock each item for purchase:

articles.author: Christian Markle
articles.description:
Fans of the Blue Box manga can now mark their calendars, as the much-anticipated anime adaptation is set to debut on October 3, 2024. The series' official website recently unveiled a brand-new trailer and key visual to further heighten the excitement for this upcoming sports-romance anime. 


Alongside this announcement, the trailer offers a first listen to the opening and ending theme songs. Popular Japanese band Official Hige Dandism is performing the series’ opening theme titled "Same Blue." Meanwhile, Eve will provide the ending theme song, "Teenage Blue."




In addition to its television debut, Netflix will stream the first two episodes on October 3, with subsequent episodes following each television broadcast. However, the release schedule will vary depending on the region. The anime will also be available on a number of other sites, including Hulu and Prime Video.


For those unfamiliar with the franchise, Blue Box is a mix of sports and romance, though more focused on the latter. The plot is centered on Taiki Inomata — a member of the boys' badminton team at Eimei Junior and Senior High — and his crush Chinatsu Kano — an older girl on the basketball team. Most of their interactions are the usual greeting during their parallel morning training, yet their relationship takes a sudden turn when Chinatsu's family is forced to move.


Fans looking to dive into the story before the anime’s release can find the Blue Box manga available to read digitally on both VIZ Media’s platform and Shueisha’s MANGA Plus.

The post Blue Box anime will premiere on October 3 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Blue Box anime will premiere on October 3

articles.description:
The six Securement Silos are a quick and relatively easy way to get loot in Once Human. In the Red Sands zone, you’ll find Securement Silo Theta, a level 45 dungeon with a secret area, a puzzle, and an extra boss.


How to reach the puzzle room in Securement Silo Theta


Screenshot by Destructoid


The Silo is filled with the standard Deviations you’ll have been mowing down for hours now. After navigating through a few branching corridors that all lead to the same location, you’ll end up in a room with two exits. The one on the left, filled with black sludge and red barrels, leads to the end boss. The doorway to the right, directly in front of where you entered, leads to the optional second boss, so head that way.


In this room, there’s a statue illuminated by a lamp. Hit F to rotate it a…
articles.title: How to solve the Securement Silo Theta statue puzzle in Once Human
